intro: Pygeum tenuinerve, commonly known as the slender-veined African cherry, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elliptical leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
